description: Tor Browser is a free, privacy-focused web browser that uses the Tor network to encrypt traffic and protect users' anonymity online.
core-features: Onion Routing, Anonymity, No Tracking by Websites, HTTPS Everywhere, No Browsing History, Cross-Platform Compatibility, Security-Focused, Automatic Updates, Anti-Censorship, Hidden Services, Exit Node Privacy, No Unique Identifiers
languages-supported: 32 (include Chinese [Simplified & Traditional], Thai, Vietnamese, Korean, Japanese)
security-privacy-features: Multi-layer Encryption, MITM Protection, NoScript, IP/DNS Leak Prevention, Traffic Obfuscation, Circuit Switching, Device Fingerprinting Resistance, Tracker and Cookie Isolation, Secure Defaults, Software Sandboxing
maintenance-sustainability: Monthly updates and a public status page. Funded by ~$7 million, with 28.5% from individual donors. Sponsored by organizations like Open Technology Fund and Fastly.
limitations-vulnerabilities: Exit node vulnerabilities, potential for correlation attacks, slower browsing speeds, some sites block Tor traffic

description: Firefox Focus is a privacy-focused mobile browser that automatically blocks trackers and erases browsing history.
core-features: Automatic Ad Blocking, Tracker Blocking, History Auto-Erase, One-tap History Clear, Search Suggestions, Custom Search Engine, Stealth Mode, HTTPS-Only Mode
languages-supported: 30+ languages including English, Spanish, French, German, Chinese, Japanese
security-privacy-features: Built-in Ad Blocking, Tracker Prevention, No Browsing History, HTTPS-Only Mode, No Session Data Storage, Biometric App Lock
maintenance-sustainability: Regular updates from Mozilla Foundation, backed by strong development team and community support
limitations-vulnerabilities: Mobile-only, limited desktop functionality, some sites may break due to strict privacy settings

description: Brave is a privacy-focused browser that blocks trackers and ads by default while offering a unique rewards system for content creators.
core-features: Built-in Ad Blocking, Tracker Prevention, IPFS Support, Tor Integration, Crypto Wallet, Brave Rewards, Video Conferencing, Offline Playlist
security-privacy-features: Fingerprint Prevention, Script Blocking, HTTPS Everywhere, WebRTC Protection, Cookie Control, Brave Shields, Private Windows with Tor
maintenance-sustainability: Regular updates, funded through Brave Rewards and partnerships, strong development team
limitations-vulnerabilities: Rewards system requires BAT cryptocurrency, some sites may break with shields enabled

description: LibreWolf is a privacy-focused fork of Firefox that comes with enhanced security settings and privacy protections enabled by default.
core-features: Privacy by Default, Telemetry Disabled, Enhanced Tracking Protection, Custom Privacy Settings, Auto-Updates, Hardened Security
security-privacy-features: No Telemetry, Enhanced Tracking Protection, Privacy Settings Pre-configured, WebRTC Disabled by Default, DRM-free, Hardened Security Settings
maintenance-sustainability: Community-driven development, regular updates following Firefox ESR releases
limitations-vulnerabilities: No mobile version, some websites may break due to strict settings, manual configuration needed for some features

description: Bitwarden is an open-source password manager with end-to-end encryption and cross-platform support.
core-features: Password Generation, Secure Notes, Two-Factor Authentication, Password Sharing, Browser Extensions, Mobile Apps, Self-hosting Option
os-compatibility: Windows, Linux, macOS, iOS, Android, Web-based
security-privacy-features: End-to-end Encryption, Zero-knowledge Architecture, TOTP Support, Data Breach Monitoring, Secure Password Sharing, Vault Health Reports
maintenance-sustainability: Active development, both community and commercial support, regular security audits
limitations-vulnerabilities: Free tier has limited sharing features, some advanced features require premium
